title: Eddie Hearn slams Tyson Fury's 'terrible' wrestling skills
text:
Eddie Hearn called Tyson Fury's wrestling skills 'terrible', but admits his WWE antics were 'great exposure' ahead of a proposed rematch with Deontay Wilder.

The Gypsy King was restrained by security after he squared up to Braun Strowman at ringside in last week's SmackDown.

Strowman threw Dolph Ziggler into Fury, causing him to fall back into his seat on Smackdown. Fury followed up the stunt by appearing on Monday Night Raw to demand an apology.

Tyson Fury could make his WWE in-ring debut at the Crown Jewel event in Saudi Arabia

Braun Strowman threw Dolph Ziggler into Fury, causing him to fall back on Smackdown

The two began trading blows before they had to be separated by WWE superstars.

His venture into wrestling has got everyone talking, even Hearn, the promoter of his rival Anthony Joshua.

Hearn told AB Boxing News: 'Terrible, terrible, you know like when you do that pretend punch, but he's obviously just rolled into it, he's character and he's perfect for stuff like that.

'I don't think his wrestling was very good but I thought it was great exposure for him.

'That's what you want, when you're promoting, the idea is to try and push your profile to non-boxing fans for people that might be interested once they've seen it.

Eddie Hearn called Fury's wrestling skills 'terrible' but admits they are 'great exposure'

Tyson Fury squares up with WWE wrestler Braun Strowman as their feud comes to a head

'I don't think anyone knew who he was, but they do now.'

Fury is aiming for a February 22 rematch against Wilder, but is also expected to confirm he will take on Strowman at WWE's Crown Jewel event in Saudi Arabia on October 31.

Hearn continued: 'I've seen the comments about Tyson Fury, "it's a disgrace", "he made a right idiot out of himself", but he knows what he's doing.

'You've got to look at the bigger picture, because look, their [Deontay Wilder and Fury] fight did 150,000 buys [PPV], it should be doing five, six, or seven hundred.

'So how do you do that, you bring in that casual audience.'
description: Eddie Hearn called Tyson Fury's wrestling skills 'terrible', but admits his WWE antics were 'great exposure' ahead of a proposed rematch with Deontay Wilder.
